org.mitre.mat.core
Class AttributeType

java.lang.Object
  org.mitre.mat.core.AttributeType
Direct Known Subclasses:
AnnotationAttributeType, FloatAttributeType, IntAttributeType, StringAttributeType
public abstract class AttributeType
extends java.lang.Object

An Abstract class defining the common behavior of all Attribute Types.

aggregationString

public static java.lang.String[] aggregationString
A list of the names of the different aggregation types, in array order corresponding to the aggregation constants above.

protected Atype atype
The parent Atype to which this Attribute belongs

name

protected java.lang.String name
The name of the attribute

optional

protected boolean optional
Specifies whether or not the attribute's value is optional

distinguishingAttrForEquality

protected boolean distinguishingAttrForEquality
Specifies whether or not this Attribute is a distinguishing attribute for equality. Used for scoring.

aggregationType

protected int aggregationType
Specifies the aggregation type of this Attribute

See Also:
LIST_AGGREGATION, SET_AGGREGATION, NONE_AGGREGATION

type

protected java.lang.String type
The type of Attribute this is. Must be set by the implementing class.

defaultValue

protected java.lang.Object defaultValue
This Attribute's default value, if any.

defaultIsTextSpan

protected boolean defaultIsTextSpan
Specifies whether this attribute's value should default to the text span of the annotation

isChoiceAttribute

protected boolean isChoiceAttribute
Specifies whether or not this attribute is considered a "choice attribute". A choice attribute is a "string" or "int" type Attribute whose value is restricted to a provided list of choices.

AttributeType

public AttributeType(Atype atype,
                     java.lang.String name,
                     boolean optional,
                     int aggregation,
                     boolean distinguishing,
                     java.lang.Object defaultValue,
                     boolean defaultIsTextSpan)
              throws AnnotationException
Full Constructor.

Parameters:
atype - the Atype to which this AttributeType will belong
name - the name of the attribute
optional - specifies whether or not this attribute's value is optional
aggregation - specifies the aggregation type of this attribute
distinguishing - specifies whether or not this attribute is a distinguishing attribute for equality
defaultValue - provides a default value (or null if there is no default)
defaultIsTextSpan - specifies whether or not this attribute's default value should be the annotation's text span (meaningless for spanless annotations). If this is true, you should not also provide a default value, and vice versa.
Throws:
AnnotationException

copy

public abstract AttributeType copy(Atype atype)
                            throws AnnotationException
Copy this AttributeType. (Implementations should return the appropriate subtypes)

Parameters:
atype - The Atype this attribute is being copied to
Returns:
a copy of this AttributeType for the given Atype
Throws:
AnnotationException

quickCopy

public AttributeType quickCopy(Atype atype)
                        throws AnnotationException
Copy this AttributeType without necessarily doing all of the validations. Defaults to calling the copy(Atype) method but can be overridden in subclasses to provide a quicker (and possibly safer) copy when certain validations can/must be skipped. Most users should call copy(Atype) instead. This is called by Atype.copy when copying all of an already-validated Atype.

Parameters:
atype - The Atype this attribute is being copied to
Returns:
A copy of this instance of AttributeType for and pointing to the Atype passed in
Throws:
AnnotationException
See Also:
copy(Atype)

checkValue

public abstract boolean checkValue(java.lang.Object v)
Check the validity of a proposed value for this attribute. Will use polymorphism to figure out if checking a list, set or single value and then check the aggregationType to make sure it's appropriate.

Parameters:
v -
Returns:

checkAndImportSingleValue

public abstract boolean checkAndImportSingleValue(MATDocument doc,
                                                  java.lang.Object value)
Check the validity of and import a value for this attribute. For Annotation attributes, importing involves registering the reference. For other types importing doesn't do anything.

Parameters:
doc -
value -
Returns:

clearValue

public abstract void clearValue(MATDocument doc)
Clear the value of this attribute. Called when values are deleted or removed from the collection, and used for Annotation attributes, to clear the reference hash.

Parameters:
doc -

choiceAttributeOK

public boolean choiceAttributeOK(AnnotationCore annot,
                                 java.lang.Object candidateVal)
use getAttributedefault instead Object getDefaultValue() { return defaultValue; } / /** Determine whether a candidate value is acceptable for this choice attribute within the given Annotation. This is general functionality for all singleton choice attributes. If you're about to change one of these values, you need to know if it CAN be changed - and it can be changed if the annotation isn't attached to anything, or if the resulting set of choice attributes satisfy SOME restriction on EACH of the places it's attached to.

Parameters:
annot -
candidateVal -
Returns:
true if the value is acceptable, or if this isn't really a choiceAttribute, and false otherwise
